active_learning.discussion_prompt: Given recent supply chain cyber incidents like SolarWinds, debate whether organizations should prioritize NIST SP 800-161 or ISO 31000:2018 for C-SCRM, considering factors like industry, organization size, and global operations. Support arguments with framework comparisons and propose hybrid approaches.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Supply Chain Risk Assessment (SCRA) within the topic hierarchy: Cybersecurity (Level 1) > Asset Security (Level 2) > Asset Provisioning (Level 3) > Governance and Compliance (Level 4) > Risk Management Integration (Level 5) > Supply Chain Risk Assessment (Level 6). Builds on prior 'Risk Management Integration' knowledge. Core Content (complete and comprehensive): - Definitions: Supply Chain (network from supplier to customer); Supply Chain Risk (disruptions/threats impacting ops/finances/security); SCRA (systematic identify/analyze/evaluate/prioritize); C-SCRM (cyber-focused, ICT/OT risks like malware/counterfeits/vulns). - Frameworks: NIST CSF GV.SC (Govern Supply Chain Risk Mgmt); NIST SP 800-161r1 (practices for federal systems: acquisition/integration/supplier mgmt); ISO 31000:2018 (Principles: integrated/structured/customized/inclusive/best available info/human/cultural factors; Framework: leadership/context/communication; Process: context, assessment(identify/analyze/evaluate), treatment, monitoring/review/improvement). - SCRA Process: 1. Map dependencies; 2. Identify threats/vulns; 3. Assess likelihood/impact (matrix); 4. Prioritize; 5. Mitigate/treat; 6. Monitor. - Big Picture: Enhances Asset Security resilience; real incidents e.g., SolarWinds. Scaffolding Layers: [Embed the exact scaffolding array from above]. Learning Objectives: [Embed the exact learning_objectives array]. Active Learning Ties: Reference discussions (SolarWinds/NIST vs ISO), peer teaching (risk ID vs mitigation), problem-solving (manufacturing scenario). Generate 40-50 flashcards following the exact flashcard_schema structure above. Output as JSON array of objects, each with 'front', 'back' (nested object), and 'metadata'. Distribute evenly across 4 layers and Bloom's levels per protocol. Ensure university-pedagogy: active recall, spaced repetition best practices, no hints on front, explanations promote deeper understanding/integration. Voter consensus: 100% approval on completeness/pedagogy. Sources: NIST.gov, ISO.org.
